authors.name: jingting
authors.affiliation: Department of Biochemistry and Biophysics; School of Medicine; UNC-CH

description: {"blocks":[{"key":"dakcr","text":"Cytogenetically detect single-cell ecDNAs in cell lines via staining/homologous DNA hybridization and fluorescence microscopy -- fluorescence in situ hybridization (FISH).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

status.info: We use this protocol and it's working

steps.step: {"blocks":[{"key":"8cpna","text":"Cytogenetically profile single-cell DNAs through metaphase karyotyping by DNA FISH.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"j8lu","text":"Methanol/glacial acetic acid 3:1 -- Prepare fresh in a fume hood prior to use","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mddf","text":"Hypotonic stock solution: 0.075M KCl (gibco, ref. 10575-0821)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4i08l","text":"2 X SSC (Saline-Sodium Citrate) stock solution (/0.05% TWEEN20)","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"5mcpi","text":"0.4 X SSC stock solution","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"6lhlt","text":"Total probes : hybridization buffer = 1 : 4 (e.g. for a master mix of 10 uL from 2 different probes, add 1 uL probe 1 + 1 uL probe 2 to 8 uL hyb buffer) -- prepare fresh","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"r35v","text":"","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"c6fd7","text":"Prepare metaphase spreads","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"v7k7","text":"Grow cells to 60-80% confluency.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8k9dg","text":"Arresting cells at metaphase: Replace old media with media with 0.1 µg/mL Colcemid diluted from 10 µg/mL stock solution (Karyomax from Gibco. Ref#15212-012), (e.g. 100 µL of 10 µg/mL Colcemid/10 ml medium) and incubate O/N (depending on the cell doubling time).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":29},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":64,"length":10},{"style":"bold","offset":28,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"79o67","text":"Warm up 0.075M KCl in 37℃ water/bead bath.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":8,"length":10}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44an3","text":"Examine if cells are mostly mitotic that round up under the inverted microscope.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"cpf69","text":"Transfer the colcemid-spiked media to a 15 ml conical tube. Wash cells with 5 ml PBS. Transfer the PBS wash to conical.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6vfb1","text":"Add 1-2 ml trypsin (depends on cell density) to the cells in a 10 cm dish and digest for 3 min at 37℃.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"an4ag","text":"Examine cells under the inverted microscope (optional). Quench the digestion by adding 3-5 ml colcemid-spiked media when most cells start to lift off (media should be at least 3 times the volume of trypsin). Gently pipette up and down 10x to flush off adhered cells.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":94,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1l2p5","text":"Transfer the collected cells to the remaining colcemid-spiked media and centrifuge at 400x G for 4 min. Aspirate the supe. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"lmcm","text":"Wash cells with PBS: If cells \u003c6 million, add 1 ml PBS; if cells ≥ 6 million, add n mL PBS, n = #cell/6 million rounded up (e.g. 2 tubes for 8 million). Gently pipette 10x to resuspend. Transfer the suspension to one or n 1.5 ml microcentrifuge tube(s). Centrifuge at 5000 rpm for 2 min and aspirate the supe.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":20},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":46,"length":9},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":82,"length":8},{"style":"italic","offset":92,"length":30}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6hcpq","text":"Swelling cells: Add 600 µl pre-warmed 0.075M KCl dropwise down the side and resuspend by tapping/very gentle pipetting --\u003e incubate for 15 min in 37℃ water/bead bath (15 min is the optimal time for swelling. Swollen cells are brittle – no vortex or pipetting hereafter. Cells must be sufficiently swollen to burst on microscope slides, whereas with excessive swelling, cells break in fixative and release cytoplasmic contaminants). Prepare fresh fixative in a fume food while waiting: ≥ 2.4 ml/pellet. Optional: place fixative on ice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":15},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":20,"length":28},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":136,"length":30},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":432,"length":102},{"style":"italic","offset":236,"length":32}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f81fm","text":"Add 600 µl Carnoy’s fixative (use 100-300 and 800-1000 µl for hundreds of K cells and ≥ 7 million cells, respectively) dropwise down the side to quench the reaction and immediately centrifuge at 5000 rpm for 2 min and aspirate/pipette the supe till a few drops (100-200 μL) left.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":4,"length":114},{"style":"italic","offset":169,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"9hhim","text":"Fixing cells: Resuspend pellets in remaining solution by gently tapping/flicking the bottom of the tube till no clumps. Add (pre-chilled) 600 µl Carnoy’s fixative dropwise down the side and flick to mix well. Centrifuge at 5000 rpm for 2 min. Aspirate/Pipette until a few drops left.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":13},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":138,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"enuds","text":"Repeat step 11 twice.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"e53u3","text":"Centrifuge and resuspend pellets in the remaining fixative. Add 300-1000 µl fixative depending on pellet size for a slightly milky suspension (over-concentrated cells are hard to profile individually and impair image quality). Cells can be stored in fixative at -20℃ for an extended time.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":85,"length":24}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
{"blocks":[{"key":"54oqn","text":"Prepare microscope slides","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":25}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"duuah","text":"Prepare slides on a clean, dust-free surface (e.g. a clean slide box). Keep the sample side clean -- NO TOUCHING/SCRATCHING. Dropped metaphase spreads must be processed within 2 days to prevent chromosome degradation. ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dtu17","text":"Addditional washing steps for pre-made metaphase samples:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8nre3","text":"Thaw -20℃ metaphase samples at RT.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8g2dn","text":"Prepare fresh Carnoy’s fixative in a fume hood while waiting.","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"8f1p5","text":"Repeat step 10 twice or more till the supernatant is clear. ","type":"ordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"aac4e","text":"Prepare 200-250 ml H20 in a 400 ml beaker. Microwave for 1-1.5 min for heated vapor.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"sub","offset":20,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4qpsc","text":"Mix the suspension well by flicking/tapping. Pipette up 10 µL.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":56,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"eafpr","text":"Place the slide over the hot water for humidity until tiny droplets are formed. Immediately drop the 10 µl suspension from height (an arm's stretch) to the moist slide. Re-humidify if the slide dries before drops hit.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"italic","offset":80,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"7nia1","text":"Briefly hover the slide above the beaker for 2-3 s to further spread chrs by humidity.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"4sg8n","text":"Age/Dry at room temp (20-25℃) 1h - overnight in a closed environment (e.g. slide box/drawer...).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"1vpco","text":"DNA FISH","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":8},{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":8}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"dvl2p","text":"Minimize exposure of fluo probes to light to limit photobleaching. Photobleaching impairs fluorescence and image contrast.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"8sims","text":"Preparations: Prepare 4 Coplin jars for 2X SSC, 70%, 85%, and 100% ethanol, enough to submerge metaphase spreads. Pre-warm DNA FISH probes in 37℃ water/bead bath; Set heat block to 70℃ based on the physical thermometer. Fill grooves in humidified chamber with dH2O and set to 37℃ --\u003e close the lid.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"bold","offset":12,"length":2},{"style":"bold","offset":193,"length":1},{"style":"italic","offset":194,"length":24},{"style":"sub","offset":262,"length":1}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"b16d0","text":"Dehydration: briefly equilibrate spreads in 2X SSC (~3 sec) and immediately transfer to ascending alcohol gradients, 2 mins w/ lid on: 70% --\u003e 85% --\u003e 100% ethanol --\u003e air-dry. While air-dry, prepare 10n µL of 1:5 probe master mix in hybridization buffer, e.g. In a colored PCR tube, add 2 µl of pre-warmed probes (Empire Genomics, stored in -20℃ protected from light), including all probes types, to 8 µl hybridization buffer (e.g. 1 µl each for 2 types of probes) and mix well by 3 pulses of vortex followed by a brief spin. For just DAPI staining, start from 28.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":12},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":44,"length":6},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":200,"length":30},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":288,"length":25},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":401,"length":25},{"style":"italic","offset":64,"length":11},{"style":"italic","offset":527,"length":38}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"6ko8u","text":"Add 5 µL of probe mix/slide onto the middle of the chromosome spread (NO TOUCHING/SCRATCHING!). Cover the spread with a 22x22 mm coverslip, taking care not to have bubbles or press too hard or slip. Push bubbles out using a pipette tip.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":4,"length":23},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":120,"length":18}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"2np0s","text":"Co-denaturation: Immediately incubate the slide in the dark on a 70-72℃ heat block for 2 min (Heat exceeding 3 mins and/or 75℃ will damage chromosome morphology).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":16},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":87,"length":5},{"style":"italic","offset":17,"length":11}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"18vte","text":"Probe hybridization: Incubate the slides at 37℃ O/N (16-20 h) in the pre-set dark humidified chamber. Humidity keeps the probe mix from drying out. Elongated hybridization leads to non-specific binding of FISH probes.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":20},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d414k","text":"After hybridization: Prepare 3 Coplin jars containing fresh 0.4X SSC, 2X SSC + 0.05% tween20, and 2X SSC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":54,"length":5}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"733jm","text":"Post-hybridization wash: Gently lift the coverslip tweezing a corner -- no scraping! Wash slides in 0.4X SSC and 2X SSC/0.05% Tween20 for 2 min each with shaking for 10-15 s. Wash briefly in 2X SSC.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":24},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":100,"length":8},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":113,"length":20},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":191,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"44qrp","text":"DAPI counterstaining: Remove excess buffer by wicking slides and wipe back of the slide clean using a paper towel. Add 1 drop of SlowFade Diamond Antifade Mountant with DAPI and seamlessly seal a 24x60 mm coverslip with nail polish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"bold","offset":0,"length":22},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":0,"length":21},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":119,"length":6},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":129,"length":45},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":196,"length":19}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"f11f4","text":"Alternative DAPI staining: add 10 µl of 1:1000 or 200 µl of 1:10000 DAPI solution per slide and stain for 2 min in the dark. Agitate briefly in 2X SSC to remove excess DAPI. Remove the buffer as much as possible and wipe the back with a paper towel (watery liquid mixed with mounting media changes optimal refractive index for imaging).","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":31,"length":16},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":50,"length":22},{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":105,"length":7}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

{"blocks":[{"key":"d27fs","text":"Add 30 µl of VectaShield mounting medium (non-hardening with anti-fade) (Optional for just DAPI staining). Seal a 24 X 60 mm coverslip with nail polish.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[{"style":"UNDERLINE","offset":114,"length":21}],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}

title: Metaphase_spread_and_DNA_FISH_cell_lines
